alert.note: Alert for Cobb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 8:25AM EST until January 26 at 8:16AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Noses Creek at Powder Springs Rd at Powder Springs affecting Cobb County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Noses Creek at Powder Springs Rd at Powder Springs. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands and the natural flood plain upstream and downstream from the gage at Powder Springs Road. A walkway parallel to the creek on the right bank will be under 4 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 10.8 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 12.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 11 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM EST.
